activity.title: A moving object with position s(t)=t^2

statement.p: Consider a moving object whose position function is given by s(t) = t^2, where s is measured in meters and t is measured in minutes.

ol.label: a

li.p: Determine the most simplified expression for the average velocity of the object on the interval [3, 3+h], where h \gt 0.
Determine the average velocity of the object on the interval [3,3.2]. Include units on your answer.

ol.li: Determine the instantaneous velocity of the object when t = 3. Include units on your answer.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Consider \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{s(3+h)-s(3)}{h} and use your work in (a).

ol.label: a
ol.li: Using the expression just found in (a) with h = 0.2, AV_{[3,3.2]} = 6 + 0.2 = 6.2 meters/min.

Taking the limit of average velocity and using our work from (a), we find that
IV_{t = 3} = \lim_{h \to 0} AV_{[3, 3+h]} = \lim_{h \to 0} 6+h = 6,
so the instantaneous velocity of the object when t = 3 is 6 meters per minute.
